title: DevSecOps Project Secrets Schema
description: Schema for project-scoped secrets files supporting plaintext and encrypted modes with environment variable injection patterns. Used by fulmen-secrets (fulsecrets) CLI tool and DevSecOps microtools.

schema_version.description: Schema version for compatibility and migration tracking

env_prefix.description: Global environment variable prefix applied to all projects (e.g., 'MYAPP_'). Optional, can be overridden at project level.

description.description: Multi-line description of the secrets file, including contact info, purpose, or usage notes.

projects.description: Array of project configurations with credentials (plaintext mode only - mutually exclusive with ciphertext)

encryption.description: Encryption metadata (present when file is encrypted)

ciphertext.description: Encrypted payload containing projects array (encrypted mode only - mutually exclusive with projects). Base64-encoded or PGP-armored format depending on encryption method.

oneOf.description: Plaintext mode: projects array is present, no encryption/ciphertext
Encrypted mode: encryption metadata and ciphertext are present, no projects array

ProjectConfig.description: Configuration for a single project including slug, credentials, and optional env prefix

project_slug.description: Slugified project identifier (lowercase alphanumeric + hyphens/underscores, used for filtering in CLI). Examples: 'myapp-prod', 'api_staging', 'worker-dev', 'my_service-v2'

description.description: Multi-line description of the project, including purpose or usage notes.

env_prefix.description: Optional prefix for all environment variables in this project. Example: 'APP_' results in APP_DATABASE_URL, APP_API_KEY, etc. Overrides global env_prefix if set.

credentials.description: Map of credential names to credential objects. Keys are environment variable names (UPPER_SNAKE_CASE), values are credential objects with type, value/ref, and optional metadata.

propertyNames.description: Environment variable names must be UPPER_SNAKE_CASE

Credential.description: Structured credential with type, value/reference, and optional lifecycle metadata

type.description: Credential type for smart masking and validation. api_key: show prefix (sk_live_...xyz), token: show suffix (...1234), password: full redaction (***REDACTED***)

value.description: Plaintext credential value. Mutually exclusive with 'ref'. Required if 'ref' is not provided.

ref.description: External reference to credential (e.g., vault path, secret manager ARN). Mutually exclusive with 'value'. Required if 'value' is not provided.

description.description: Human-readable description of the credential's purpose or usage.

metadata.description: Optional lifecycle and ownership metadata for tracking credential lifecycle.

rotation.description: Optional rotation policy for credential lifecycle management.

CredentialMetadata.description: Lifecycle and ownership metadata for credential tracking

created.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when credential was created

tags.description: Categorization tags for filtering and grouping (e.g., ['production', 'critical'])

RotationPolicy.description: Rotation policy for credential lifecycle management

method.description: Rotation method: auto (automated rotation) or manual (manual rotation required)

EncryptionMetadata.description: Metadata tracking encryption method, key, and timestamp for roundtrip plaintext â†” ciphertext operations

key_id.description: Key identifier for decryption. For GPG: key fingerprint (e.g., '7A8B9C0D1E2F3A4B'). For age: public key (e.g., 'age1ql3z...'). Omit for passphrase-based encryption.

encrypted_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when encryption was performed

cipher.description: Cipher algorithm used (e.g., 'AES-256-GCM', 'ChaCha20-Poly1305'). Optional but recommended for auditability.

PolicyConfig.description: Policy enforcement configuration for secrets files

allow_plain_secrets.description: Whether to allow plaintext (unencrypted) secrets files. Set to false for production/compliance environments to enforce encryption ('FIPS mode'). Defaults to true.
